ResourceHeader.Description: The John W. Evans Solar Facility (ESF) is two telescopes in one, both tracking the solar cycle. A 16" coronagraphic telescope maps magnetic changes in the Sun's outer atmosphere. A special set of 12" coelostat optics "squints" so the Sun appears as a pinpoint, allowing an "apples and apples" comparison with the cycles of distant stars.

InformationURL.Name: John W. Evans Solar Facility Homepage
InformationURL.Description: Detailed information about the Evans Solar Facility including instruments and data.
